body:
Yep, only a few leftwing people can handle the reception that rightwing people get on reddit. 

I do wish there were more here though. The endless leftwing circle jerk is one of the things I grew to hate about reddit. Ruqqus is headed down a similar path. I would like to only use ruqqus, but I find myself going back and forth to reddit just for a *bit* of balance.

> Yep, only a few leftwing people can handle the reception that rightwing people get on reddit.

That's not the issue at all. Leftwing people typically don't associate with people who want them to die / not have rights.

Rightwing people, however, will try their best to ruin other people's days or try to flaunt how "better" they are because XX and XY chromosomes are talked about in 8th grade biology books.

post.title: Where is the leftwing ruqqus guilds

body:
You don't at all think you are painting the rightwing with a broad brush?

Libertarians don't really give a shit what you do, as long as it doesn't harm them and I doubt that many conservatives "want them(lefties) to die / not have rights." Things have certainly gotten more extreme in the last few years, but I don't think we are at *that* point yet. 

I live in a leftwing area and honestly, it seems like a lot of it is projection. You guys are angry and hateful and project that on everyone who disagrees with you even though only the extreme right are on similar levels of anger. That's been my experience anyway. I don't think all leftists are like this obviously, but enough of them are that they are able to have a noticeable effect on society and policy. Neo-Nazi's don't have anywhere near the power that the angry leftwing does.

That said, you don't have to associate with anyone that you don't want to. Blocking people and guilds is very easy.
body_html:
You don't at all think you are painting the rightwing with a broad brush?

Neo-Nazi's don't have anywhere near the power that the angry leftwing does.

That said, you don't have to associate with anyone that you don't want to. Blocking people and guilds is very easy.

body: At least among my own family and friends this perspective has shifted, as well as on ruqqus. They've moved from small government conservatives striving for equality under the law to suddenly favoring bans on blacks, non-whites, and lgbt, and a zeal for "return to tradition" of monarchies and patriarchal families, removing women from the workforce and anywhere outside the home, children should be seen and not heard, and most concerning, support for censorship of speech opposing such. Not everyone is among them, and some have been left behind and abandoned. They tell me they've "woken up" and realized that liberty is dangerous, but I believe they're actually just scared of everything that happened in 2020 and are willing to take drastic measures against it at all costs.

Not everyone is among them, and some have been left behind and abandoned. They tell me they've "woken up" and realized that liberty is dangerous, but I believe they're actually just scared of everything that happened in 2020 and are willing to take drastic measures against it at all costs.

body:
I suppose you're right, they're trying to figure out where things went wrong that we now have an ideologically leftist authoritarian thing happening here. Where did this society allow the dam to break? Aim too recently, and you end up ultimately supporting the same things that led to what's happening now. When did the Tocqueville effect take hold?

It's a good question. I am shocked that the people I thought were rational, freethought kind of people are now enrolled in this censoring witch-hunt. It's the question of where we went wrong. What dam did we break that we should have left alone? The right answer, for some people, is finding the answer as far back in time as possible lest you be too conservative with your choice.

I suppose you're right, they're trying to figure out where things went wrong that we now have an ideologically leftist authoritarian thing happening here. What dam did we break that we should have left alone? The right answer, for some people, is finding the answer as far back in time as possible lest you be too conservative with your choice.

Not everyone is among them, and some have been left behind and abandoned. They tell me they've "woken up" and realized that liberty is dangerous, but I believe they're actually just scared of everything that happened in 2020 and are willing to take drastic measures against it at all costs.
parent.body_html: At least among my own family and friends this perspective has shifted, as well as on ruqqus. They've moved from small government conservatives striving for equality under the law to suddenly favoring bans on blacks, non-whites, and lgbt, and a zeal for "return to tradition" of monarchies and patriarchal families, removing women from the workforce and anywhere outside the home, children should be seen and not heard, and most concerning, support for censorship of speech opposing such. Not everyone is among them, and some have been left behind and abandoned. They tell me they've "woken up" and realized that liberty is dangerous, but I believe they're actually just scared of everything that happened in 2020 and are willing to take drastic measures against it at all costs.

I suppose you're right, they're trying to figure out where things went wrong that we now have an ideologically leftist authoritarian thing happening here. Where did this society allow the dam to break? Aim too recently, and you end up ultimately supporting the same things that led to what's happening now. When did the Tocqueville effect take hold?

It's a good question. I am shocked that the people I thought were rational, freethought kind of people are now enrolled in this censoring witch-hunt. It's the question of where we went wrong. What dam did we break that we should have left alone? The right answer, for some people, is finding the answer as far back in time as possible lest you be too conservative with your choice.
